description: Structured field definitions for all CPMAI core and conditional artifact templates. Supplemental Agent artifacts use the markdown template system in docs/cpmai/agents/.

fieldTypes.table: Inventory, matrix, or structured evidence collection

problem-definition-document.name: Problem Definition Document
problem-definition-document.description: Defines the business problem in terms suitable for AI/cognitive solution evaluation. Establishes whether the problem requires AI or if non-cognitive alternatives suffice.

fields.label: Business Problem Statement
fields.helpText: State the specific business problem this AI initiative addresses. Include measurable impact of the current state (cost, time, error rate). This drives feasibility assessment and scopes all downstream work. Example: 'Customer support response time exceeds 24 hours for Level 1 inquiries, costing $2M annually with 62% satisfaction.'

fields.label: Current Non-AI Approach
fields.helpText: Describe the manual, rule-based, or deterministic method currently addressing this problem. CPMAI requires establishing this heuristic baseline to justify cognitive investment. If no current approach exists, state that explicitly.

fields.label: Justification for AI Over Non-Cognitive Solution
fields.helpText: Explain why a cognitive/AI approach is necessary. Address specifically why rule-based, statistical, or manual approaches are insufficient. If a non-AI approach is 'good enough,' the project should not proceed as an AI initiative.

fields.label: AI Pattern Classification
fields.helpText: Select which of the Seven Patterns of AI this project implements. Guides algorithm selection, data strategy, and team composition. If multiple patterns apply, select 'Multiple Patterns' and detail in the rationale.

fields.label: Problem Scope
fields.helpText: Classify scope. Narrow scope projects have higher success rates in initial CPMAI iterations. Start constrained and expand iteratively.

fields.label: DIKUW Target Level
fields.helpText: Projects targeting Data/Information levels may not require AI. Knowledge and above typically justify cognitive approaches. Affects model complexity and evaluation criteria.

fields.label: Cognitive Objectives
fields.helpText: List each cognitive task the AI must perform with measurable target, baseline, and minimum threshold. Example: Objective='Classify tickets by intent', Target='85% accuracy', Baseline='Manual at 60%', Threshold='75%'.

stakeholder-analysis.name: Stakeholder Analysis
stakeholder-analysis.description: Identifies all parties affected by the AI initiative, their roles, influence, and commitment levels.

fields.label: Project Sponsor
fields.helpText: Name and role of the executive sponsor. CPMAI requires a committed sponsor who will deploy the solution into production. Without this, the project is a 'No-Go'.

fields.label: Production Commitment Obtained
fields.helpText: CPMAI requires explicit sponsor commitment to deploy. 'No commitment obtained' is a Go/No-Go red flag.

fields.label: Stakeholder Registry
fields.helpText: Map each stakeholder's interest, influence, and disposition. High-influence resisters require mitigation strategies.

fields.label: AI Project Team Composition
fields.helpText: CPMAI recommends: data engineer, data scientist, SME, project manager, IT/ops at minimum. 'Unassigned' roles represent staffing risks.

success-criteria.name: Success Criteria
success-criteria.description: Defines objective, measurable success and failure criteria. Establishes the superiority test vs. the heuristic baseline.

fields.label: Business KPI Targets
fields.helpText: List each business KPI with baseline, target, measurement method, and the threshold separating success from failure. Evaluated in Phase 5.

fields.label: Technical Performance Targets
fields.helpText: Define ML performance metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1, latency) that translate business KPIs into model-level acceptance criteria.

fields.label: AI Superiority Test
fields.helpText: Define how the AI must perform better than the heuristic baseline. CPMAI requires probabilistic superiority — state what 'better' means quantitatively.

fields.label: ROI Estimation Approach
fields.helpText: Primary ROI justification. Implementation costs must be offset within 12-24 months. 'Strategic/qualitative' requires stronger rationale.

fields.label: Estimated Time-to-ROI
fields.helpText: Projected time from deployment to positive ROI. Include best/base/worst case. Beyond 24 months is a CPMAI red flag.

fields.label: Explicit Failure Criteria
fields.helpText: Define what constitutes project failure. Prevents scope creep and moving goalposts. Evaluated at Phase 5 gate.

project-charter.name: Project Charter
project-charter.description: Formalizes the AI project scope, authority, constraints, and timeline.

fields.label: Project Name
fields.helpText: Official project name used across all governance artifacts.

fields.label: Project Description
fields.helpText: What this AI project delivers, who it serves, and how it connects to organizational strategy. This is the authoritative scope statement.

fields.label: Delivery Approach
fields.helpText: CPMAI is agnostic to orchestration layer and integrates with Scrum, SAFe, or stage-gates.

fields.label: Constraints and Boundaries
fields.helpText: 'Blocking' constraints that cannot be resolved are Go/No-Go red flags.

fields.label: Target Start Date
fields.helpText: Planned execution start date for Phase 2 activities.

fields.label: Target Completion Date
fields.helpText: Target date for first iteration deployment. CPMAI is iterative — not a fixed deadline.

fields.label: Pilot vs. Proof-of-Concept Decision
options: MVP — minimal viable model for stakeholder evaluation
fields.helpText: Pilots provide better ROI signals than PoCs. PoCs risk never transitioning to production.

risk-assessment.name: Risk Assessment
risk-assessment.description: Identifies and classifies risks specific to this AI initiative across business, data, and execution dimensions.

fields.label: AI Risk Registry
fields.helpText: Use CPMAI three-pillar feasibility model: Business, Data, Execution. High/High risks without mitigation are Go/No-Go red flags.

fields.label: Overall Risk Posture
options: Critical — unmitigated risks may prevent success
fields.helpText: 'Critical' should trigger escalation to sponsor before Phase 1 gate.

regulatory-requirements-analysis.name: Regulatory Requirements Analysis
regulatory-requirements-analysis.description: Assesses regulatory and compliance obligations applicable to this AI initiative.

fields.label: Applicable Regulatory Frameworks
fields.helpText: Check all applicable frameworks. Drives data handling (Phase 2-3), evaluation criteria (Phase 5), and governance controls (Phase 6).

fields.label: AI System Risk Classification
options: High risk — full compliance framework required
fields.helpText: Classify per most stringent applicable framework. High-risk triggers additional governance artifacts.

fields.label: Compliance Requirements by CPMAI Phase
fields.helpText: Map each requirement to where evidence must be produced. Prevents late discovery of compliance gaps.

data-source-inventory.name: Data Source Inventory
data-source-inventory.description: Catalogs all data sources with classification, ownership, access, and sensitivity. One artifact per data source.

fields.label: Data Source Name
fields.helpText: Unique identifier for this data source. One inventory artifact per source.

fields.label: Data Source Type
fields.helpText: Determines Phase 3 preparation complexity and Phase 4 algorithm selection.

fields.label: Data Owner / Steward
fields.helpText: Accountable data owner who authorizes access and is responsible for governance.

fields.label: Data Sensitivity Level
options: Prohibited — Cannot be used for AI
fields.helpText: 'Restricted' and above trigger mandatory privacy controls in Phase 3. 'Prohibited' blocks use entirely.

fields.label: Personal Data Present
options: PII present — required for model function
fields.helpText: Determines anonymization requirements in Phase 3 and whether PIA is needed. 'Unknown' must be resolved before Phase 2 gate.

fields.label: Access Status
fields.helpText: 'Access denied' without escalation path is a Go/No-Go red flag.

fields.label: Volume Metrics
fields.helpText: Record quantity: record count, fields per table, file size, date range. Volume determines sufficiency for train/val/test splits.

fields.label: Data Retention Category
options: Regulatory hold — retention mandated by law
fields.helpText: Affects retraining feasibility in Phase 6 and audit requirements.

fields.label: Identified Data Quality Risks
fields.helpText: Known quality issues: missing values, inconsistency, noise, bias, staleness, duplicates. Directly informs Phase 3 cleaning.

fields.label: Planned Quality Risk Mitigations
fields.helpText: For each quality risk, describe mitigation approach and the CPMAI phase where it will be addressed.

data-quality-report.name: Data Quality Report
data-quality-report.description: Quantitative assessment of data quality across completeness, consistency, accuracy, and sufficiency.

fields.label: Completeness Assessment
fields.helpText: Report missing value percentages by field. Distinguish random vs. systematic gaps — systematic gaps often cannot be fixed by Phase 3 cleaning.

fields.label: Consistency Assessment
fields.helpText: Report format inconsistencies, conflicting values across sources, unit mismatches, and encoding issues.

fields.label: Ground Truth / Accuracy Verification
fields.helpText: How were ground truth labels verified? Label accuracy determines model ceiling. State verification method and estimated accuracy rate.

fields.label: Data Sufficiency Verdict
options: Insufficient — additional data required before Phase 3
fields.helpText: 'Insufficient' blocks Phase 2 gate without a documented acquisition plan.

fields.label: Bias Indicators Detected
fields.helpText: Class imbalances, demographic skews, temporal biases, sampling biases. Tracked from here through Phase 5 fairness evaluation.

fields.label: Quality Score Summary
fields.helpText: Summarize across: Completeness, Consistency, Accuracy, Timeliness, Sufficiency, Bias. 'Critical' requires remediation plan before gate.

data-dictionary.name: Data Dictionary
data-dictionary.description: Defines each data field/feature with type, format, business meaning, and expected values.

fields.label: Data Field Registry
fields.helpText: One row per field. Business definitions must be understandable by non-technical stakeholders.

fields.label: Target Variable Definition
fields.helpText: For supervised learning: define target variable, possible values, and ground truth determination method. For unsupervised: describe expected output structure.

fields.label: Feature Relevance Assessment
options: Initial assessment complete — pruning planned for Phase 3
fields.helpText: Irrelevant features increase noise and cost. Early assessment improves Phase 3 efficiency.

initial-data-exploration-report.name: Initial Data Exploration Report
initial-data-exploration-report.description: Documents EDA findings: distributions, correlations, outliers, and patterns relevant to the AI problem.

fields.label: EDA Summary
fields.helpText: Key findings: distribution shapes, dominant patterns, unexpected correlations, outlier prevalence. Focus on findings that change decisions.

fields.label: Data-to-Requirement Mapping Verdict
options: Data contains essential elements for selected AI pattern
Data partially covers requirements — gaps identified
Data does not support selected AI pattern — iteration needed
fields.helpText: 'Does not support' should trigger iteration back to Phase 1 to reassess problem definition or pattern selection.

fields.label: Key Risks Surfaced by EDA
fields.helpText: Risks not anticipated in Phase 1: unexpected distributions, data leakage indicators, label noise, temporal gaps.

data-lineage-documentation.name: Data Lineage Documentation
data-lineage-documentation.description: Traces data from origin through transformations. Required for regulated environments.

fields.label: Data Lineage Map
fields.helpText: Acquisition method must be reproducible for Phase 6 retraining cycles.

privacy-impact-assessment.name: Privacy Impact Assessment
privacy-impact-assessment.description: Evaluates privacy risks and documents required controls for regulatory compliance.

fields.label: PII Inventory
fields.helpText: Catalog every PII element. Determine whether the model requires it or it can be removed/anonymized in Phase 3.

fields.label: Overall Privacy Risk Level
options: Low — no PII or fully anonymizable
High — PII required for model function
Critical — sensitive PII without adequate controls
fields.helpText: 'Critical' requires escalation to privacy/legal counsel before Phase 3.

data-cleaning-documentation.name: Data Cleaning Documentation
data-cleaning-documentation.description: Documents all cleaning operations: deduplication, error correction, missing value handling, normalization.

fields.label: Cleaning Operations Log
fields.helpText: Log each step. 'Verified=No' requires follow-up before Phase 3 gate.

fields.label: Missing Value Strategy
options: Flag and model — missingness as feature
fields.helpText: Strategy affects model bias. Justify against Phase 2 quality findings.

fields.label: Anonymization Verification
items: All PII from Phase 2 PIA addressed
fields.helpText: Verify Phase 2 privacy controls are implemented. CPMAI requires confirmation anonymization doesn't harm performance.

fields.label: Pre vs. Post Cleaning Comparison
fields.helpText: Key metrics before/after: record count change, null rate, duplicate removal rate, features dropped. Supports audit trail.

feature-engineering-documentation.name: Feature Engineering Documentation
feature-engineering-documentation.description: Documents derived features, transformations, and encoding strategies.

fields.label: Feature Transformations
fields.helpText: Document each derived attribute with rationale connecting to model requirements.

fields.label: Feature Selection Method
fields.helpText: 'All features retained' acceptable for small datasets but increases noise for large feature sets.

fields.label: Unstructured-to-Structured Conversions
fields.helpText: Document tokenization, embeddings, vectorization, image preprocessing, etc. if applicable.

data-transformation-pipeline.name: Data Transformation Pipeline
data-transformation-pipeline.description: Documents the reusable pipeline for data ingestion, cleaning, transformation for training and inference.

fields.label: Training Data Pipeline
fields.helpText: End-to-end reusable pipeline: steps, tools, dependencies, execution frequency. Must be reproducible for Phase 6 retraining.

fields.label: Inference Data Pipeline
fields.helpText: How live data flows through the same transformations. Differences from training pipeline must be documented.

fields.label: Pipeline Reproducibility Status
fields.helpText: 'Not yet reproducible' blocks Phase 3 gate. Pipeline must be at minimum documented and scripted.

training-validation-test-split.name: Training/Validation/Test Split Documentation
training-validation-test-split.description: Documents the data partitioning strategy for model training, validation, and testing.

fields.label: Split Ratios
fields.helpText: CPMAI standard: typically 70/15/15. Document actual ratios and stratification.

fields.label: Split Method
fields.helpText: Must prevent data leakage. Temporal splits required for time-series.

fields.label: Data Leakage Verification
items: No future information leaks into training data
No target variable derivatives in feature set
Same entity does not appear in multiple partitions
fields.helpText: Data leakage produces inflated metrics that collapse in production. Each item is a Phase 3 gate requirement.

data-augmentation-strategy.name: Data Augmentation Strategy
data-augmentation-strategy.description: Documents strategies for increasing training data volume and diversity.

fields.label: Augmentation Methods
fields.helpText: Document each technique: derived attributes, transformations, oversampling, paraphrasing.

fields.label: Augmentation Validation Approach
fields.helpText: Unvalidated augmented data can distort training distributions.

synthetic-data-generation-plan.name: Synthetic Data Generation Plan
synthetic-data-generation-plan.description: Documents synthetic data generation method, quality controls, and privacy considerations.

fields.label: Justification
fields.helpText: Justification determines generation method and validation rigor.

fields.label: Generation Method
fields.helpText: Technical approach: generative AI, SMOTE, domain simulators. Include tools and parameters.

fields.label: Quality Controls
items: No private data embedded in outputs
fields.helpText: Synthetic data without controls can introduce subtle biases.

model-selection-rationale.name: Model Selection Rationale
model-selection-rationale.description: Documents algorithm and technique selection tied to AI pattern, data characteristics, and business constraints.

fields.label: Modeling Technique
fields.helpText: Must align with AI pattern from Phase 1. Misalignment is a common failure mode.

fields.label: Specific Algorithm(s)
fields.helpText: Name algorithm(s) and justify. Include why alternatives were rejected.

fields.label: Pre-trained Model Usage
fields.helpText: Pre-trained models accelerate development but require vetting for domain compatibility and hallucination risk.

fields.label: Modeling Assumptions
fields.helpText: Assumptions about data (distributions, independence, stationarity) and environment (latency, compute). Violated assumptions cause production failures.

hyperparameter-tuning-documentation.name: Hyperparameter Tuning Documentation
hyperparameter-tuning-documentation.description: Records hyperparameter search strategies, initial and optimized settings.

fields.label: Hyperparameter Settings
fields.helpText: Document each tunable parameter. 'Default' should be justified — defaults rarely produce optimal results.

fields.label: AutoML Tool Usage
fields.helpText: CPMAI accepts AutoML but requires understanding what it selected and why.

fields.label: Cross-Validation Design
fields.helpText: k-fold value, stratification, temporal considerations. Prevents overfitting.

model-architecture-documentation.name: Model Architecture Documentation
model-architecture-documentation.description: Records technical architecture: layers, components, I/O specs, compute requirements.

fields.label: Architecture Description
fields.helpText: Layers, dimensions, activation functions, input/output shapes. For LLMs: base model, prompt structure, RAG architecture.

fields.label: Model Input Specification
fields.helpText: Exact input format, dimensions, feature ordering. Contract between Phase 3 pipeline and model.

fields.label: Model Output Specification
fields.helpText: Output format: probabilities, values, generated text, confidence scores. Define downstream consumption.

fields.label: Compute Requirements
fields.helpText: Training compute (GPU hours, memory) and inference compute (latency, throughput). Mismatches cause deployment failures.

training-procedure-documentation.name: Training Procedure Documentation
training-procedure-documentation.description: Documents end-to-end training procedure: initialization, optimization, stopping criteria, reproducibility.

fields.label: Training Procedure
fields.helpText: Step-by-step: initialization, optimizer, LR schedule, batch size, epochs, early stopping, regularization. Must be reproducible.

fields.label: Reproducibility Controls
fields.helpText: Critical for Phase 6 retraining and audit compliance.

fields.label: Training Duration and Cost
fields.helpText: Wall-clock time and compute cost. Informs Phase 6 retraining budgets.

ensemble-strategy-documentation.name: Ensemble Strategy Documentation
ensemble-strategy-documentation.description: Documents use of multiple combined models with combination method and evidence.

fields.label: Ensemble Method
fields.helpText: Justify ensemble over single-model — complexity and maintenance cost increase.

fields.label: Component Models
fields.helpText: Ensemble must outperform best individual model to justify added complexity.

transfer-learning-documentation.name: Transfer Learning Documentation
transfer-learning-documentation.description: Documents pre-trained model usage, domain adaptation, and fine-tuning.

fields.label: Source Model Details
fields.helpText: Name, version, training domain, provider, license. CPMAI requires domain compatibility assessment.

fields.label: Adaptation Method
fields.helpText: Affects compute cost, overfitting risk, and domain specialization achieved.

fields.label: Domain Compatibility Assessment
fields.helpText: Mismatched domains produce subtle failures (hallucination, confident wrong answers) that are difficult to detect.

model-performance-metrics.name: Model Performance Metrics
model-performance-metrics.description: Records technical model performance against Phase 1 success criteria.

fields.label: Performance Metrics
fields.helpText: Evaluate each metric from Phase 1 Success Criteria. 'Below — unacceptable' on critical metrics blocks Phase 5 gate.

fields.label: Overfitting Assessment
fields.helpText: Significant gap between train/test indicates memorization, not generalization.

fields.label: Confidence Score Analysis
fields.helpText: Analyze confidence distribution. High-confidence errors are most dangerous. Document production confidence threshold.

validation-results.name: Validation Results
validation-results.description: Documents validation against holdout test set and business KPIs from Phase 1.

fields.label: Business KPI Evaluation
fields.helpText: Phase 5 accountability table. 'Failure' on critical KPIs triggers iteration to earlier phases.

fields.label: Stakeholder Acceptance Status
fields.helpText: CPMAI acknowledges subjective judgment. Technically strong models may still be rejected.

fields.label: Iteration Decision
fields.helpText: CPMAI phases are iterative. Unsatisfactory results should trigger return to appropriate earlier phase.

error-analysis-report.name: Error Analysis Report
error-analysis-report.description: Analyzes patterns in model errors to identify systematic failure modes.

fields.label: Error Pattern Analysis
fields.helpText: Analyze false positives and negatives for systematic patterns: data segments, edge cases, ambiguous inputs, temporal patterns.

fields.label: False Positive Impact Assessment
fields.helpText: Business impact of FP. Some domains tolerate high FP (screening); others cannot (fraud blocking).

fields.label: False Negative Impact Assessment
fields.helpText: Business impact of FN. Missed detections can be costlier than false alarms.

comparison-to-baseline.name: Comparison to Baseline
comparison-to-baseline.description: Compares model performance to the heuristic baseline from Phase 1.

fields.label: Baseline Comparison
fields.helpText: CPMAI superiority test. AI must demonstrably outperform heuristic baseline.

fields.label: Superiority Verdict
options: AI marginally superior — proceed with monitoring
AI inferior to baseline — iterate or terminate
fields.helpText: 'Inferior to baseline' should trigger serious project reconsideration.

fairness-and-bias-analysis.name: Fairness and Bias Analysis
fairness-and-bias-analysis.description: Evaluates model outputs for fairness across protected groups.

fields.label: Bias Assessment Results
fields.helpText: CPMAI Trustworthy AI requires bias detection. 'Significant' disparities require mitigation before deployment.

fields.label: Fairness Standard Applied
fields.helpText: Different standards can conflict. Choosing one accepts trade-offs with others.

robustness-testing-results.name: Robustness Testing Results
robustness-testing-results.description: Tests model behavior under adversarial, edge-case, and distribution-shift conditions.

fields.label: Robustness Test Results
fields.helpText: Test edge cases: missing inputs, adversarial examples, out-of-distribution data, extreme values.

deployment-plan.name: Deployment Plan
deployment-plan.description: Defines deployment strategy, infrastructure, integration, and CI/CD pipeline.

fields.label: Deployment Strategy
fields.helpText: Determines infrastructure, latency, and monitoring. Must align with Phase 1 business requirements.

fields.label: Infrastructure Configuration
fields.helpText: Cloud/on-premise, auto-scaling, database integration, encryption, network security. Include model scaffolding: non-AI components needed (API gateway, auth, UI integration).

fields.label: CI/CD Pipeline Status
fields.helpText: CPMAI recommends CI/CD for reproducible updates. Manual is acceptable initially but represents ongoing risk.

fields.label: Integration Points
fields.helpText: Document each system the model connects to and integration readiness.

monitoring-strategy.name: Monitoring Strategy
monitoring-strategy.description: Defines monitoring, drift detection, retraining triggers, and alerting for the deployed model.

fields.label: Monitoring Metrics
fields.helpText: System health, uptime, latency, prediction confidence, business KPIs. Each metric needs a threshold and action plan.

fields.label: Drift Detection Method
fields.helpText: Data drift and model drift are primary causes of production degradation. Both must be monitored.

fields.label: Retraining Schedule
fields.helpText: CPMAI requires planned retraining. 'No retraining planned' is an operational risk that should be justified.

fields.label: Low Confidence Response Handling
fields.helpText: What happens when the model produces low-confidence predictions? CPMAI recommends fallback to heuristic or human escalation.

rollback-procedure.name: Rollback Procedure
rollback-procedure.description: Documents the process for reverting to previous model version or heuristic fallback.

fields.label: Rollback Trigger Criteria
fields.helpText: Define specific conditions that trigger rollback. Each condition needs a measurable threshold and detection method.

fields.label: Rollback Procedure
fields.helpText: Step-by-step rollback process: who initiates, how the previous version is restored, what systems are affected, expected downtime, and communication plan.

fields.label: Heuristic Fallback Available
options: No — full outage on model failure
fields.helpText: CPMAI recommends maintaining the heuristic baseline as operational fallback. 'No fallback' is a significant operational risk.

documentation-for-end-users.name: Documentation for End Users
documentation-for-end-users.description: Documents how end users interact with the AI system, limitations, and escalation paths.

fields.label: User Interaction Model
fields.helpText: Defines the human-AI interaction mode. This affects training requirements, trust expectations, and error handling.

fields.label: Known Limitations
fields.helpText: Document what the AI cannot do, known failure modes, and conditions where accuracy degrades. Transparency builds trust and prevents misuse.

fields.label: Escalation Paths
fields.helpText: How users escalate when the AI produces unexpected, incorrect, or low-confidence results. Must include human contact path.

ab-testing-plan.name: A/B Testing Plan
ab-testing-plan.description: Documents A/B or shadow testing approach for validating model performance in production.

fields.label: Test Design
fields.helpText: Define test groups, traffic split, duration, success metrics, and statistical power requirements.

fields.label: Test Type
options: Shadow mode (parallel with no user impact)
fields.helpText: Shadow mode is lowest risk for initial deployment. A/B testing provides strongest causal evidence.

fields.label: Test Success Criteria
fields.helpText: What must the test demonstrate before full rollout? Include statistical significance requirements and minimum test duration.

model-governance-documentation.name: Model Governance Documentation
model-governance-documentation.description: Establishes governance framework for ongoing model management, modification authority, and compliance.

fields.label: Governance Structure
fields.helpText: Define who has authority to approve model updates, retrain decisions, and retirement. Include escalation hierarchy and decision-making process.

fields.label: Model Modification Policy
options: Any change requires governance board approval
Minor tuning allowed, major changes need approval
fields.helpText: CPMAI recommends formal change control for production models. 'No formal policy' is a governance gap.

fields.label: Audit Compliance Readiness
items: All CPMAI phase artifacts complete and traceable
Decision rationales documented at each gate
Data lineage and transformation history preserved
Regulatory evidence mapped to applicable frameworks
fields.helpText: CPMAI production models must survive audit without oral explanation. Each unchecked item is an audit risk.
